title: Descriptionâ€‹
content: This cell renders a date. A date must match the selected date format.

title: Usageâ€‹
content: Select a date cell to open the date cell edit menu. Type a date value. Press Enter or return for it to be saved. If the value is invalid, a red outline will appear around the input. Fix the value and press Enter or return for it to be saved. To close the menu without saving, click outside of the menu or press esc. The date format is how the date will be displayed. Changing the date format from the cell will change the date format for all cells in the column. You may clear the date by pressing the clear button.

title: Usageâ€‹
content: When the menu opens, a list of vault notes will appear. Type any value to filter the list of notes. Notes are filtered using the fuzzy sort algorithm. You may use the up and down arrow keys to navigate the list. Click an item or press Enter or return to select the highlighted value. The value you choose will be saved.

title: Descriptionâ€‹
content: This cell renders a tag. A tag belongs to a column. It can be assigned to multiple cells within a column.

title: Usageâ€‹
content: When the menu opens, you will see an input and a list of the column tags. Type a value into the input to filter the list of tags. If a tag with the value of the input doesn't exist, a Create button will appear. Click the button or press Enter or return to create the tag. To add an existing tag, select any tag from the list. If a tag has already been choosen for the cell, the current tag will be updated with the one you have chosen. To edit a tag, select the three dots button. The tag edit menu will appear. You may delete the tag by clicking Delete. To choose a new color for the tag, click any of the color options.

title: Links to Notesâ€‹
content: Create a link to a note by typing two front brackets [[. A file suggestion menu will then appear. Type any value to filter the list of notes. You may also use the up and down arrow keys to navigate. Click an item or press Enter or return to select the highlighted item. The value you choose will be saved. Links follow the same syntax as Obsidian wiki links.

title: Insert a new lineâ€‹
content: By default, pressing Enter or return will close the edit menu. To insert a line, hold down the shift key while pressing Enter or return.

title: Wrap contentâ€‹
content: If enabled, the content of a cell will wrap instead of being cut off when the cell width is smaller than the content width.

title: Date formatâ€‹
content: The format in which a unix time value should be displayed. There are 5 different formats Month/Day/Year - e.g. 05/01/2023 Day/Month/Year - e.g. 01/05/2023 Year/Month/Day - e.g. 2023/05/01 Full - e.g. May 1, 2023 Relative - e.g. Yesterday 5:36 pm

title: Install the pluginâ€‹
content: In Obsidian, open SettingsGo to Community pluginsSelect BrowseSearch for DataLoom by Trey WallisSelect InstallThen select Enable Your browser does not support the video tag.

title: Configure Obsidianâ€‹
content: DataLoom saves data in JSON format in .loom files. Enable detection of loom filesâ€‹ By default, Obsidian doesn't display .loom files in the suggest menu that opens when you type double brackets [[. For Obsidian to do this, you must enable the detection of all file extensions. In Obsidian, open SettingsSelect File & LinksToggle Detect all file extensions Your browser does not support the video tag. Enable syncing of loom filesâ€‹ By default, Obsidian doesn't sync .loom files between devices. For Obsidian to do this, you must enable syncing of all file extensions. In Obsidian, open SettingsSelect SyncChoose and connect to a remote vaultIn the remote vault settings, Toggle Sync all other typesRepeat these steps on all devices that you want to sync .loom files to Your browser does not support the video tag.

title: Descriptionâ€‹
content: The rendering of rows in a loom table is virtualized, meaning that they are only rendered when you scroll to them. This allows the loom to render thousands of rows with minimal lag. The plugin uses react-virtuoso for virtualization.

title: Matching columnsâ€‹
content: A column is considered matched when it is assigned to a column in the loom or when it is toggled off. You can toggle a column off by selecting the checkbox in the table header. If you wish to toggle all columns off or on, select Toggle all. To match a column, select the match icon on the right side of each column header. A dropdown will appear with all of the columns in your loom. Select the column you wish to match to. If you wish to create a new column, select New column. After a column has been matched, it cannot be used by other columns. If you wish to assign a column to a different column, you must first unmatch the column. To unmatch a column, select Unmatch. Your browser does not support the video tag.

title: Basic usageâ€‹
content: Please make sure that you have enabled detection of loom files A loom may be embedded into a note by using the embedded file syntax. Example loom ![[filename.loom]]  An embedded loom will preform the same functions as a normal loom, the only limitation being a smaller window. Changes that are made to an embedded loom will be saved to the loom file. Changes made to an embedded loom will also update any open tabs that contain a loom.

title: Setting a width and heightâ€‹
content: An embedded loom has a default width of 100% and a default height of 340px. A height of 340px will render exactly 4 body rows. If you would like to modify the width or height of a loom, you can use the embedded image syntax. Note: setting a value of 0 will use the default value.
